Quantifiers and QP - Partitives All of the quantifiers, including numbers, can normally occur in constructions. These constructions are used to signify that one is talking about just a part of a larger group. Examples include:
some of the children. several of the older girls. many of the women. just this much of the food. only ten of the boys.
As the examples show, partitive constructions of this type normally have a prepositional or postpositional phrase modifying the quantifier, which indicates the group or full item being discussed. Note that in all of these examples, the noun in the partitive phrase can be further modified by a relative clause.
Some languages may use a relative clause to express the group of the partitive construction instead of a prepositional or postpositional phrase.
